assessments.task_description:
A formal page limit is not enforced. Nonetheless, a student is expected to dedicate approximately 10 hours of study per week for each 2-unit research project course. In the shorter Summer Semester, the expected weekly commitment increases proportionally to approximately 16.25 hours per week. This standard will be taken into consideration when assessing students' deliverables.

You are not required to follow a specific formatting or referencing style. However, the presentation and citation of your work must be clear, applied consistently throughout, and align with the established standards of your discipline.

DECLARATION

For students who have not signed a Confidentiality Agreement, you must include one of the following two consent declarations on the title page of your report:

I grant permission for copies of this report to be made available as a learning resource to students enrolled at The University of Queensland.

or

I do not grant permission for copies of this report to be made available as a learning resource.

Here, a Confidentiality Agreement (CA) is not a standard requirement for research projects. It is mandatory only in cases where the research involves confidential data, Intellectual Property, or other sensitive materials. When necessary, the supervisor will manage the preparation of the agreement, clarify its terms, and facilitate the signing process with the student.

MARKING

Marks are awarded on the following basis:

  • Quality of introduction /20%
  • Demonstration of understanding key elements /30% (40% for projects in Mathematics Education)
  • Rigour of definitions, proofs, calculations, etc. /20% (not for projects in Mathematics Education)
  • Appropriate style of writing /20% (30% for projects in Mathematics Education)
  • Appropriate referencing /10%
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment must be prepared in PDF format and submitted via the Blackboard system.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

Project Defense must be scheduled on or before the last Friday of the Examination period, depending on the availability of student and supervisor. If a recording is required, it must be uploaded by the due time.
assessments.task_description: The project defense comprises a 15-minute presentation followed by a 10-minute question-and-answer session. The project defense is intended to assess the student's genuine understanding of their research project and their ability to communicate their work clearly and confidently. During the defense, the student is expected to give a concise summary of the project's objectives, methodology, and findings, and to respond thoughtfully to questions from the examiner regarding the project's background, approach, results, and significance.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The project defense must be video recorded when there is only one examiner. In such cases, the recording must be uploaded to Blackboard.
